item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, February 9, 2025 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. LIMO: Less Is More for Reasoning (92 points | 36 comments)
2. Persistent packages on Steam Deck using Nix (24 points | 7 comments)
3. Don't "optimize" conditional moves in shaders with mix()+step() (234 points | 95 comments)

5. Teen on Musk's DOGE team graduated from 'The Com' (17 points | 4 comments)
6. PhD Knowledge Not Required: A Reasoning Challenge for Large Language Models (20 points | 7 comments)
7. Baffled by generational garbage collection – wingolog (77 points | 48 comments)

9. 3D reconstruction of the capital of the Aztec empire (212 points | 48 comments)
10. Rwandan scientists develop local yeast for banana wine-makers (84 points | 45 comments)
11. Show HN: My first side project, streamlined book clubs on Slack (70 points | 32 comments)
12. Mission Accomplished? Heat pump adoption has a long way to go (17 points | 24 comments)
13. Classic Data science pipelines built with LLMs (127 points | 69 comments)

20. Emergence of collective oscillations in human crowds (71 points | 33 comments)

22. Daily omega-3 fatty acids may help human organs stay young (9 points | 1 comment)
23. Jacksonpollock.org (2003) (465 points | 122 comments)
24. Hard disk fraud: long runtimes on new Seagate hard disks (90 points | 62 comments)
25. Antimony Atoms Function as Error-Resistant Qubits (26 points | 2 comments)

27. Cell-Based Architecture Explained, with Zombies (30 points | 8 comments)

29. Obscure islands I find interesting (495 points | 161 comments)
